column4: US STOCKS-Wall Street gains on Fed hopes after weekly loss
column5: NEW YORK  June 17 U.S. stocks rose 1 percent early on Monday  with traders focused on expectations the Federal Reserve will reinforce this week its commitment to supporting the economic recovery.

column4: US STOCKS-Wall Street set to rise after weekly loss  Fed eyed
column5: NEW YORK  June 17 U.S. stocks were set to rise at the open on Monday after major indexes on Friday closed their third negative week in four  with traders focused on expectations the Federal Reserve will reinforce its commitment to supporting the economic recovery.

column4: Orchard Supply files for bankruptcy  Lowe's steps in
column5: Orchard Supply Hardware Stores Corp   spun off by Sears Holdings Corp  less than two years ago  has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection partly blaming hefty dividends paid out to its former parent.

column4: Embraer launches next E-Jets to strong demand  SkyWest orders up to $9.4 billion
column5: PARIS Brazilian planemaker Embraer SA  launched a bigger and more efficient lineup of commercial E-Jets at the Paris Airshow  with a robust show of demand as it pushed deeper into a segment that rival Bombardier had staked out with its new narrow-body CSeries.

column4: Embraer wins up to 365 potential next-gen E-Jet orders
column5: PARIS Brazilian planemaker Embraer  unveiled up to 365 potential orders for its revamped E-Jet aircraft at the Paris Airshow on Monday  including a firm order for 100 E-175s from U.S. company SkyWest Inc .

column4: AIRSHOW-Embraer to announce SkyWest  ILFC orders-source
column5: PARIS  June 17 Regional airline operator SkyWest  will be the launch customer for Embraer's  second-generation E-Jets with an order for 100 aircraft on Monday  according to a source with knowledge of the deal.

column4: Carlyle plans more CLOs as closes 350 mln euro fund
column5: LONDON  June 17 Private equity firm The Carlyle Group said on Monday it had raised a 350 million euro ($467.16 million) Collateralized Loan Obligation (CLO) fund to invest in European bank loans.

column4: Britain's FTSE rises  lifted by demand for defensives
column5: LONDON  June 17 Britain's top share index rose on Monday  as demand for safe-haven consumer staples helped to lift the FTSE 100 off of six week lows ahead of a U.S. monetary policy meeting later this week.

column4: Deals of the day -- mergers and acquisitions
column5: June 17 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 2000 GMT on Monday:

column4: Telefonica denies report of $93 billion offer from AT&T
column5: MADRID Telefonica  said on Monday it had not received any indication of interest from AT&T   following a Spanish newspaper report that the government had halted a 70 billion-euro ($93 billion) offer from the U.S. company.

column4: Qatar mulls being launch customer for 777 upgrade
column5: PARIS Qatar Airways is talking to Boeing  about being a launch customer for a successor to its mini-jumbo  the 406-seat 777-9X  Chief Executive Akbar Al Baker said at the Paris Airshow on Monday.

column4: AIRSHOW-UPDATE 1-Qatar mulls being launch customer for 777 upgrade
column5: PARIS  June 17 Qatar Airways is talking to Boeing about being a launch customer for a successor to its mini-jumbo  the 406-seat 777-9X  Chief Executive Akbar Al Baker said at the Paris Airshow on Monday.

column4: Boeing wins $354 million upgrade for French AWACS planes
column5: PARIS Boeing Co  on Monday said it had won a contract valued at $354 million for a major upgrade of four French E-3F Airborne Warning and Control System (AWACS) aircraft.

column4: AIRSHOW-Boeing wins $354 mln upgrade for French AWACS planes
column5: PARIS  June 17 Boeing Co on Monday said it had won a contract valued at $354 million for a major upgrade of four French E-3F Airborne Warning and Control System (AWACS) aircraft.

column4: AIRSHOW-WRAPUP 1-Orders for big jets make a splash in Paris
column5: PARIS  June 17 Big finance waded into a rain-soaked Paris Airshow with more than $10 billion in orders for jumbo passenger jets as planemakers duelled over strategy for large aircraft on Monday.

column4: Boeing executive sees 100-200 international tanker sales
column5: PARIS Chris Chadwick  president of Boeing's  military aircraft division  said the company could sell 100 to 200 of its KC-46 refueling tankers to international customers in coming years.

column4: AIRSHOW-Boeing executive sees 100-200 international tanker sales
column5: PARIS  June 17 Chris Chadwick  president of Boeing's military aircraft division  said the company could sell 100 to 200 of its KC-46 refueling tankers to international customers in coming years.

column4: Qatar Airways buys up to nine Boeing 777-300ER
column5: PARIS Qatar Airways has signed an agreement to buy up to nine Boeing  777-300ER aircraft valued at $2.8 billion at list prices  the airline said at the Paris Airshow on Monday.

column4: AIRSHOW-Leasing company GECAS to order Boeing 787-10X
column5: PARIS  June 17 GECAS  the aircraft leasing arm of General Electric  has committed to buying 10 Boeing  787-10X aircraft pending the launch of the extended variant of the plane  the company said at the Paris Airshow on Monday.

column4: AIRSHOW-SkyMark Airlines says to order Boeing 737 MAX planes
column5: PARIS  June 17 Japan's SkyMark Airlines  has signed an agreement to buy at least four Boeing 737 MAX aircraft  the company said at the Paris Airshow on Monday.

column4: Chesapeake hires former SEC lawyer as compliance officer
column5: HOUSTON Chesapeake Energy Corp  on Monday named as chief compliance officer a lawyer the oil and gas company had previously hired to respond to an investigation by the Securities and Exchange Commission.

column4: Chesapeake hires former SEC lawyer as compliance officer
column5: HOUSTON  June 17 Chesapeake Energy Corp  on Monday named as chief compliance officer a lawyer the oil and gas company had previously hired to respond to an investigation by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.

column4: U.S. gives Tesoro green light to buy Chevron assets
column5: WASHINGTON Oil refiner Tesoro Corp won approval from U.S. antitrust regulators to buy Northwest Products Pipeline system and related assets from Chevron Corp  on the condition it sells a petroleum terminal in Boise  Idaho.

column4: Tesoro to sell Boise petroleum terminal to win US deal approval
column5: WASHINGTON  June 17 U.S. antitrust regulators have given oil refiner Tesoro Corp and its logistics subsidiary approval to buy Northwest Products Pipeline system and related assets from Chevron Corp  on the condition that its sells a petroleum terminal in Boise  Idaho  the Federal Trade Commission said on Monday.

column4: Chevron jumbo gets US high-grade market off to strong start
column5: June 17 (IFR) - Chevron Corp on Monday kicked off the week for the US primary high-grade market with a six-part deal expected to be sized at about USD5bn.

column4: Nigeria hires Citi and Deutsche Bank ahead of potential Eurobond
column5: LONDON  June 17 (IFR) - The Federal Republic of Nigeria  rated BB-/BB-  has appointed Citigroup and Deutsche Bank to arrange a series of fixed income investor meetings ahead of a potential Eurobond issue  according to a market source.
